186015279.review:
O jogo é legal basicamente um GTA na china, a história bem construída com personagens legais e um mapa bem atrativo. O que mais gostei do jogo foi o modo de luta (Kung Fu do Wei Shen) e tem uma missão secundária, que em resumo, você participa de um torneio de Artes Marciais em um ilha, o mais legal desse torneio é a cinemática dos anos 80, mostrando você indo para ilha de barco com uma cutscene como se fosse um filme mesmo e a cada bossfight há mais cutscenes nesse estilo, passando por desafios e muitas lutas. Claro que o jogo não é somente isso, no entanto foi a parte que mais gostei.

Sobre as conquistas, elas não são difíceis somente um pouco trabalhosas, você jogando normalmente para finalizar a história principal ganhará a maioria naturalmente, porém os 100% é necessário jogar as DLCs (que são boas). Você precisa ficar muito de olho nas missões secundárias que aparecem no mapa porque as vezes aparecem somente um ícone de exclamação no minimapa indicando algo e isso ocorre em lugares e tempos diferentes, caso apareça faça logo, se deixar para o final do jogo fica meio chato de se fazer, porque precisa esperar e estar no lugar certo. Essas são as conquistas fáceis, as mais chatas (não são difíceis) são as que você precisa de tirar ouro em algumas ações, como por exemplo, salto mais longo, dirigir sem bater por um tempo (este tipo), você pode refazer missões depois de finalizar a história principal facilitando essas conquistas de ações.

Para finalizar, o jogo é ótimo, não é um GTA que possuí uma infinidade de coisas a mais de se fazer com um mapa gigante, mas o que está no jogo foi bem trabalhado e eu gostei o que joguei, vale muito a pena o jogo ser recomendado e compre somente na promoção nenhum jogo vale o preço cheio.

185852502.review:
И так, не будем тянуть кота за причинное место и сразу начнем раскидывать за данную игру. 
Сюжет рассказывает нам о полицейском под прикрытием, которому дали задачу влиться в сильнейшую триаду (мафию) города Гонконг и сделать все, чтобы она постепенно перестала существовать, но в итоге все оказывается не так просто. 
Начнем с плюсов игры: По факту игра является некой помесью GTA и серии АС, ведь из них были взяты в качестве идеи не самые худшие механики. Отличная сюжетная ветка, которая ведет к достаточно интересному и немного неожиданному финалу. Отлично сделанные кат-сцены, которые являются крайне кинематографичными. Великолепно поставленные бои с разнообразием приемов. Имеется ряд интересных побочных квестов, а именно - полицейских расследований.
Теперь о минусах: Говоря откровенно, порт на ПК - параша. Не удобное управление (да, к нему можно привыкнуть, но тем не менее), ужасная физика автомобилей, отсутствие текстур в некоторых местах на карте, а также мышь, которая ведет себя крайне некорректно особенно в миссиях с гонками. Реализация паркура могла бы быть очень даже хорошей, но здесь она никакая по причине того, что можно взбираться только в строго отведенных, помеченных местах. В остальном весь паркур сводится к тому, что при нажатии клавиши ты можешь перепрыгнуть через забор чуть быстрее, чем если бы ты на нее не нажимал. Я дважды начал проходить игру и в первый раз забросил только из-за кривого управления и идиотской камеры.
В общем, если захотите в это поиграть - берите джойстик. 
Также в комплекте есть два DLS. Одно из них про призраков, а до второго я так и не добрался и вряд ли в принципе доберсусь. С призраками просто неинтересно.

ИМХО 5/10 
Рекомендую только из-за главной сюжетной линии и дополнительных полицейских расследований.

185697507.review:
Sleeping Dogs — это криминальный боевик в открытом мире, который погружает в атмосферу Гонконга с его яркими улицами, триадами и уличными потасовками. Вы играете за Вэя Шэня, полицейского под прикрытием, балансирующего между долгом и лояльностью к преступному миру.

Боевая система впечатляет: рукопашные схватки с элементами кунг-фу доставляют массу удовольствия, а импровизированное оружие и окружение делают драки кинематографичными. Сюжет предлагает качественную, хоть и типичную криминальную драму. Однако побочные задания порой ощущаются однообразными, а управление транспортом кажется слегка аркадным.

Гонконг в игре живет своей жизнью, но миру не хватает глубины и интерактивности. Тем не менее, атмосфера и стиль компенсируют недостатки, а саундтрек приятно дополняет антураж.

Оценка: 7,5/10 — крепкий экшен, который стоит попробовать, если любите восточный колорит и фильмы о мафии.

185696054.review: Personally one of my favorite games ever made, solid game play and a gripping story. Would recommend

185694464.review:
Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition takes the beloved 2012 open-world action game and gives it the HD treatment, elevating the experience with improved visuals and all the previously released DLC packed into one action-packed package. Set in the neon-lit streets of Hong Kong, the game casts you as Wei Shen, an undercover cop navigating the treacherous world of the city's most dangerous criminal organizations. With brutal hand-to-hand combat, high-speed chases, and a rich story, Sleeping Dogs stands out as one of the more unique open-world action titles.

The Definitive Edition is, well, definitive. The visuals have received a significant upgrade, with sharper textures, improved lighting, and higher resolution, making the vibrant cityscapes and gritty alleyways come to life. Whether you’re driving through the bustling streets, beating up a gang in a dimly lit warehouse, or simply enjoying the game's gorgeous landscapes, the enhanced graphics make it feel like a whole new experience—without losing the charm of the original.

What really sets Sleeping Dogs apart, though, is its combat system. The game draws heavy inspiration from martial arts movies, and the hand-to-hand combat is both fluid and visceral. The counter system is smooth, allowing Wei Shen to use the environment to his advantage, whether slamming enemies into walls, or using weapons to make battles even more brutal. The combat flows seamlessly into the rest of the action, whether you’re engaging in shootouts, races, or exploration.

The story is another standout. As an undercover cop, Wei Shen’s loyalty is constantly tested, and the narrative keeps you on the edge of your seat. It’s a great mix of classic crime drama and action, with a cast of interesting characters and plenty of twists and turns. Wei’s moral dilemma—choosing between his duty as a cop and his immersion in the criminal world—adds a layer of depth that gives the game real emotional weight.

Beyond the core story, Sleeping Dogs offers plenty of side missions and activities, from street races to collectibles, ensuring that there’s always something to do when you're not advancing the plot. The game’s world is alive with vibrant side characters, interesting shops, and plenty of chaos waiting to be uncovered.

The Definitive Edition also bundles all the DLC expansions, which add additional missions, costumes, and weapons, extending the fun and giving you more reasons to return to the game. Whether you're diving into the story again or tackling the extra content, there's plenty to keep you entertained.

However, no game is without its flaws. The driving mechanics can be a little stiff at times, and while the world is richly detailed, the AI can feel predictable and repetitive, particularly during police chases. But these are minor issues in an otherwise well-crafted experience.

In conclusion, Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition is a thrilling, cinematic ride that combines the best elements of action, open-world exploration, and a gripping crime story. With its stunning visuals, refined gameplay, and the addition of DLC content, it’s the ultimate version of an already exceptional game. Whether you're new to Sleeping Dogs or revisiting Wei Shen's journey, this edition is well worth your time.

185674832.review:
**Sleeping Dogs: Um GTA com kung-fu e trote de porco**  

Sleeping Dogs é como aquele primo distante do GTA que resolveu fazer kung-fu em vez de dirigir tanque nas ruas. Você é Wei Shen, um policial infiltrado em Hong Kong, e seu trabalho é basicamente equilibrar duas vidas: a de um policial exemplar e a de um gangster que daria orgulho ao Toretto. Spoiler: você acaba sendo péssimo em ambas, mas de uma forma hilariamente divertida.  

Primeiro, vamos falar das mecânicas de combate. Não existe arma? Sem problema! Wei Shen transforma qualquer luta de rua em uma aula de Muay Thai. Socos, chutes, piruetas e o poder absoluto de jogar alguém em um aquário cheio de peixes assassinos! Sério, não sabia que um peixe dourado poderia ser tão mortal.  

Os veículos? São como montanhas-russas de Hong Kong. Você pode saltar de um carro em movimento para outro como se estivesse gravando *Velozes e Furiosos 23: O Contrabando de Dim Sum*. Ah, e não podemos esquecer a habilidade de atropelar alguém e ouvir os pedestres dizendo coisas que soam como um "De novo esse cara!".  

A história? É um *novelão*. Traições, laços familiares, e um vilão que você jura que vai morrer na metade do jogo... mas aí descobre que ele ainda tem pelo menos duas reviravoltas guardadas. É tipo um filme de Jackie Chan, mas com menos escadas e mais sopas de morcego (não pergunte).  

E o que falar da gastronomia? Você pode parar para comer noodles e instantaneamente se sentir mais saudável, como se a Coca-Cola tivesse propriedades medicinais. Comer dá buffs! Quem precisa de whey quando você tem um bao?  

Mas o ponto alto? O minigame de trote de porcos. Isso acontece no início do jogo, e você nunca vai esquecer o Wei Shen carregando um porco gritando como se estivesse no meio de um ataque terrorista suíno. É tão aleatório que parece que os desenvolvedores disseram: "Vamos fazer algo tão bizarro que ninguém vai esquecer".  

Resumindo: Sleeping Dogs é um GTA que tomou chá de Kung Fu Panda e decidiu que a vida seria mais divertida com porrada coreografada e missões secundárias absurdamente cômicas. Se você nunca jogou, faça um favor a si mesmo e jogue. Wei Shen te espera... e provavelmente com um soco voador.

185547030.review:
If you’ve ever dreamed of being an undercover cop who can roundhouse kick gangsters into fish tanks, vault over tables like Jackie Chan, and eat suspiciously delicious street food all in one afternoon—congratulations, Sleeping Dogs is your dream simulator.

Let me start with this: the game lets you shove bad guys into swordfish. SWORD. FISH. Where else can you do that? Skyrim? No. Elden Ring? Not even close. Sleeping Dogs? Absolutely. 10/10 for creative use of seafood in combat.

The story is like every crime drama you’ve ever loved but with extra spice (literally, it’s Hong Kong): Wei Shen, the protagonist, is basically a mix of Bruce Lee and a guy who owes your grandma money. He infiltrates the Triads while balancing his cop duties, his loyalty to his childhood buddies, and his desire to punch anyone who gives him side-eye. It’s gripping, emotional, and ridiculously fun. Also, Wei Shen could absolutely beat every other undercover cop in gaming history in a fight. Sorry, Cole Phelps, you're not even close.

The combat? Oh, it’s a dance. A brutal, bone-crunching, limb-snapping dance. You don’t just punch; you kung fu the living daylights out of everyone in sight. Every fight is a highlight reel, and just when you think you’re safe, the game throws in machetes, guns, and yes, more swordfish.

Driving? Hong Kong is your playground. You can hijack moving cars like it’s a casual Wednesday or ram enemies off the road while drifting. Physics takes a smoke break, but you won’t care because it’s so much fun. The only downside? I’m convinced every taxi driver in this game got their license from a cereal box. Pure chaos.

And oh, the side content! You can go on dates, sing karaoke (badly), or even help a guy find out who peed in his soup. No joke. It’s a little like GTA, but instead of blowing up police stations, you’re helping old ladies and buying pork buns. (Pro tip: never skip the pork buns. “Best in Hong Kong!”)

The only real downside? You’ll spend 90% of the game wishing Wei Shen could stop looking so cool in literally every outfit. It’s honestly rude. My fashion sense will never recover.

TL;DR: Sleeping Dogs is an absolute banger. It’s John Wick meets Yakuza with a side of Kung Fu Hustle. If you’re not playing this game, you’re missing out on the most fun you’ll have in an open world that smells like street noodles and chaos.

185504983.review:
По началу, думал что это на подобии ГТА игра, но только ущербная, и не интересная.  И в первые часы я так и думал. Нету стрельбы, сюжет не особо цепляющий, музыка никакая, геймплей только одни драки на кулаках. 
 
И на какое-то время я игру забросил. И в какой-то определённый момент, у меня в мозгу что-то щёлкнуло. И мне начало нравится происходящее. Например, я начал проникаться боёвкой. Я ей стал жанглировать как бог, и она как-то начала мне нравиться. Гонки всё ещё что-то между "норм" и "скучно", но в целом, всё остальное начало становиться лучше. Ты чувствуешь, что огнестрел в этой игре впринципе и не нужен, ибо система сражений тут кроет практически все возможные необходимости в огнестреле. Однако когда тебе дают пострелять из пушки, ты чувствуешь что иногда пострелять из пушки очень даже прикольно, и ты ощущаешь наличие оружия как вишенка на торте. Также и музыка становится более подходящей под события, и ты проникаешь сюжетом ещё больше. Тебе становится интересно узнать что и как пойдёт на этот раз. Сюжет тут о том, что ты являешься копом под прикрытием, и также вступаешь в криминальную банду, из-за чего ты начинаешь представлять переживания главного героя, начинаешь представлять каково это, жить двумя жизнями. Ты постепенно начинаешь понимать криминальную жизнь, и то как тут всё устроено, и понимаешь что полиция даже хуже чем криминалы. Особенно мне понравился персонаж, который казалось бы второсортный, и нахер не нужен. Но он был с тобой практически на всём прохождении, он почти всегда тебя сопутствовал, и ты начинаешь привыкать к нему как к родному человеку. И то что его под конец очень жестоко убивают ставит тебя в ступор, и есть ощущение что внутри души у тебя теперь груз который не снимется никогда, и это похвально. 
Хотя меня забавляет то, что я больше переживал за этого персонажа, нежели чем сам гг. 
 
И также наличие кастомизации персонажа это отдельный бальзам на душу для меня, боёвка и стрельба становится куда круче и интереснее со своим набором одежды, и видеть катсцены в своём облике - просто невообразимый кайф. 
 
Оценка - 8/10. Поскольку там есть DLC, которые лично меня не интересуют, ибо для меня история закончилась на финале, и проходить DLC не особо хочется.

[h2] Графика [/h2]
Графика довольно приятная но не много долбит глаза из за яркости, думаю что тогда графика была на высоте.

Сюжет сделан очень даже хорошо, даже современные игры не могут таким похвастаться. Спойлерить особо не буду просто скажу что в сюжете очень хорошие розвязки а под конец игры ты поймешь кто настоящая угроза. 
[h2] Открытый мир [/h2]
Очень вайбовый, разработчикам удалось передать суть Гонконга и все его прелести. После прохождения игры есть чем занятся. Особенно хочу упоминуть гонки, тут они мне очень зашли тем что на разных гонках можно использовать машину только 1 класса. То есть на дороге не будет спорткаров которые лучше или хуже твоего, так сказать баланс.
[h2] Геймплей [/h2]
Сразу хочу сказать про боевку игры на которой она как раз заточена, [b] это шедевр [/b]. сколько же ты можешь делать разных комбо, от ударов ногой в живот, до того что ты за секунду можешь повалить противника. Очень зашла фишка, что бы изучать новые техники надо ходить на тренировки, добавляет игре реализма. Что мне не очень зашло это ходьба, тут она просто блеводская.
[i] Еще хочу добавить что мне не понравилось, то что в игре есть  довольно хорошее количество багов. [/i]
[h2] Итоги [/h2]
Игра довольно средняя но в тоже время очень хорошо, рекомендую пройти!

185259744.review:
Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition - по две стороны закона, или же образцовая игра  2012 года.
Плюсы:
Сюжет:-  напоминает смесь мафии и гта, миссии интересно проходить, каждая миссия интересна.
Атмосфера:- кататься по дождливым улицам Китая, под китайский рэпчик - было круто,  та и за все эти 22 часа, атмосфера не терялась.
Боёвка:- тут тебе и драки с приемами, и перестрелки с происходящим мясом на экране, в целом не даст заскучать.
Фишки:- в игре есть и другие плюхи, по типу караоке, покера, свиданий, дополнительных миссий, что дополняет мир, подобное так-же встречается в Yakuza.
Цена:- карманные деньги
Нейтральное:
Длс:- длс в отличии уже от сюжета, как по мне посредственные, местами интересно проходить, местами хотелось бросить.
Минусы:
Баги:-что портят немного погружение в мир, к примеру можно угораздить заползти место откуда нету выхода.
Не интерактивное радио:- его нельзя переключать, лишь только менять машину. 
Недоработанность:- игра может вылететь, и миссию придется начинать сначала, решатеся это проверкой файлов игры. 
Итоги:
Игра получилась добротной, стоит копейки, взамен дает интересную историю которая может вовлечь в себя полностью. обязательно к приобретению.

9.5 копо-ганста из 10

10/10 would reenact every kung fu movie ever again.

185104243.review:
推荐的唯一理由：港式gta目前无竞品。
gta出来之后，这类沙盒游戏就逃脱不了gta的影子了，该作也一样，他的近战格斗机制配合跑酷机制非常的好玩且流畅，在被人群包围时你也可以靠格挡，缴械和控制技脱离险关，但相对应的，游戏的架势和枪战就显得非常的屎，而且游戏的大部分时间你都需要有一个车子才能有游玩体验，车子的手感非常的奇怪。
但游戏的剧情很好，是非常好经典的港式黑帮片，不过节奏是美国人脑内的港片，充斥着大量的刻板印象，估计玩的时候都能让你笑出来。

提及本作就不得不提另外一个《真实犯罪》系列了，该作与GTA有不解之缘，直到《圣安地列斯》刷新销量记录，成为当年头号游戏作品之时，该作就再也没能掀起波浪了，于是这个本该2010年发售的第三作隔了两年才完成。
《真实犯罪》有两大招牌，第一块是近战系统，第二块是善恶系统，这两个系统是让该作游戏得以竞争gta的最大原因。
为什么要提这个呢？因为本作把这个两个系统做大幅度强化了。

首先是近战系统，该作增加了互动性极高的环境击杀，打斗技能比前几代更为流畅，而且有一种类似升级的机制，需要你在武馆活动，收集相关物品学会新的技能从而让角色更为灵活。跑酷机制的引入让追赶系统也变得有意思了起来，但可惜游戏里的追赶任务都太长太蠢，加上游戏里神奇的延迟，跑酷的体验并不是很好。

善恶系统在本作里进行了简化，游戏主角的身份是一个卧底警察，在游戏全程中你会有红任务和篮任务两种，支线也分为黑帮支线和警察支线，更进一步，主角的技能系统也分为警察技能和黑帮技能两套，警察是“经验”，黑帮则是“声望”。而主线任务也自然是拥有两套评分：从0开始加的黑帮评分和从满分开始扣的警察评分，最终任务的完成会直接影响到你两套技能的获得情况，虽然有一点烦，但在游戏过程中也仅仅是让你不要大杀特杀而已。

当然剩下的就实在是不行了，枪战非常的垃圾，可以见到制作组的重点并不在这里，射击分为盲射和点射，为了进一步降低难度甚至给了你偷跑方案：从车头滑铲过去会有一段子弹时间，追逐射击战中只要射中轮胎车子就会直接翻滚爆炸，代入感很强，但可惜这中体验完全被车子的垃圾手感给砸掉了。游戏的汽车驾驶属于是谁玩谁都得不吱声，只要摸过赛车游戏，你就会发现本作的驾驶系统就像操控一辆橡皮泥一样：拥有及其逆天的撞车机制，速度和扭矩完全不成正比，唯一好的情况下是骑着摩托高速撞车也不会让主角飞起来。

游戏的剧情重点在于刻画黑帮之间的“兄弟情义”以及警察之间的“利益关系”，这两方的正反派对调是从血色婚礼开始的，这个任务时黑帮头头对男主的信任值达到最高，马上就要接近掌权，此时被自己的上司狠狠地搞了一手，而且自己好不容易建立起的“关系”被亲手毁灭，是个人都要骂自己的上司有这么让人送命的吗。
但话说回来了，结局处理的就太槽了，首先兄弟莫名其妙死了，突然出来了处刑人，然后拷问男主，经典腰子一刀然后电钻钻膝盖一套连招下来，男主还能蹦跶一路杀到渔船，实在是太不科学了，这么一个设计让这种偏向于现实的热血故事直接变成了科幻片，但就这个地方，本该8分的剧情只能打个3分。

顺带一提，制作组功课做的很多，但显然做的并不怎么细，最大的一点在于主角的纹身：过肩龙，睁眼关公，鹰捉毒蛇。男主从小混混混到红棍还不死，我觉得大概率是朱老温看他善保他，不然我真不知道小弟纹这个怎么能活下来

El juego es muy divertido, la historia es bastante interesante ya que te mantiene atento a lo que pasará a continuación constantemente y en que habrá algún giro de guion a la vuelta de la esquina. 
Me gusta mucho que el juego tenga varios medidores para hacer progresar a tu personaje, como la reputación que puedes conseguir como policía, en las triadas y una reputación general en la ciudad que se consigue a partir de ayudar a la gente y que te desbloquean poder comprar nuevas prendas en las tiendas repartidas por la ciudad o nuevas mecánicas para tu personaje. Sin hablar de las estatuas de jade repartidas por la ciudad que puedes usar para conseguir nuevos estilos de combate o los santuarios para aumentar la vida máxima.

Hay bastantes cosas para hacer por la ciudad en cada rincón, ya sean hackeos, misiones de policía, batallas de gallos (literalmente), karaoke, peleas por rondas, carreras de coches… etc. 

Gráficamente está muy conseguido y más para la época, hay que recordar que es un juego que salió en ps3 y Xbox 360. 
La única pega que le puedo poner es el manejo de la cámara, me molesta mucho no poder moverla tan libremente como me gustaría y el manejo de vehículos, aunque esto último es perdonable ya que añade mecánicas como saltar de vehículo a vehículo que hacen la conducción alocada y divertida.

Ya me pasé este juego y conseguí el platino en ps3, pero es tan bueno y está rebajado a tan buen precio que merece totalmente la pena rejugarlo.

184706739.review:
[h1] Китайский полицай-мафиози [/h1]

Sleeping Dogs - это гта, если бы торчок Тревор решил бросить дурь, и освоить кунг-фу. 

Бои в этой игре настолько приятны, что вы начинаете драться со всеми подряд просто так, чтобы посмотреть на анимацию.

Вы можете просто кататься по миру, и смотреть на красоты Гонконга.

Можете заняться уличными гонками. Можете уплыть на кунг фу турнир, чтобы помериться силами с другими мастерами.

Вы можете в роли полицейского бить рожи бандитов-мафиози, и наоборот. 

В целом, в этой игре много разнообразных миссий, но иногда вы останавливаете все, чтобы спеть караоке.
В конце концов, зачем сражаться с мафией, если можно подпевать классике 80-х?)

Это прекрасная игра, и мне очень жаль, что ни о каком "продолжении" речи и быть не может.

184684767.review:
Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition – 8/10  
Es un juego altamente recomendable, aunque no me gustaría encasillarlo como un "GTA chino", ya que tiene muchas diferencias. En cuanto a jugabilidad, podría compararlo con títulos como Saints Row o Just Cause. Su trama es interesante, aunque no llega a ser sobresaliente. El tiempo fue duradero con 47 horas de juego, lo cual fue alrededor de dos días de juego. Considerando esto, la duración me parece bien, podría haber durado un poco mas.

Lo mejor del juego son, sin duda, las peleas, tanto con como o sin armas. Son muy divertidas y bien implementadas. El manejo de vehículos, por otro lado, no me convenció; me pareció algo tosco, con el control que resbalaba demasiado o no se deslizaba lo suficiente.

Los gráficos, aunque los jugué en calidad baja, son bastante bonitos y bien detallados y presentaba algún tipo de lag o bajón de fps. El mapa es algo regular, ya que en ocasiones no sabía en qué ciudad me encontraba o no me percataba de que había cambiado de una a otra. A pesar de eso, me gustó que el juego te permita salir de la ciudad inicial desde el principio.

La historia es GOD pero el final lo podría considerar incompleto, esta bien donde lo dejaron pero se siente que podría haber llegado a mas, las misiones secundarias son buenas, no todas pero están bien, conseguir el platino fue por lejos lo mas divertido, el conseguir todos los coches,ropa y coleccionables fue la mayor obtención de dopamina que el juego puede darte la verdad

En resumen, Sleeping Dogs es un gran juego y, personalmente, me motivó a conseguir el platino. Lo recomiendo, especialmente si lo consiguen con descuento.

184583425.review:
Dunno man, this one really shows its age. GTA: Hong Kong edition with no real likable characters.
Character movement and vaulting/parkour system feel jank. 
Combat is fun, if very easy. Gimmick outfits can give you special enhancements to make the combat more enjoyable in spurts. Still gets old pretty quickly since the combat is just that easy and the moves aren't that satisfying.
I don't feel very compelled by the main story. Not sure if there's too many "busywork" missions between key-events or what it is, but I find myself not really wanting to do the missions I *have* to do for the HKPD while wanting to push the rest of the story along. Yes, I know it's supposed to intertwine more than it initially does and be more interesting eventually. But the early portion of the game doesn't hold much intrigue, and wanting to see more of the Triad insider stuff but *having* to go do an entire other quest about street racing before the story can get out of its own way is just annoying. 

To make the obvious comparison; the Yakuza series does story much, much better than Sleeping Dogs. I would also argue the Yakuza series does side-quests/novelty events (i.e, karaoke and one-off events) much better (and yes I'm talking about the OG Yakuza games, since 0 and the Kiwami remakes didn't happen until 2015 onward - and Sleeping Dogs came out in 2012, the same year Yakuza 5 released). 

I think I got it for free because I had the original version on Steam. Even so, I'd only recommend this if you get it on steep discount and are really bored otherwise. 
Game mechanics and fluidity have come a long way since this game released, and it's really hard to go back to the jankiness that this game brings.

184575070.review:
Sleeping Dogs: Um Clássico Subestimado do Gênero

Imagine um mundo aberto onde você sente o peso de cada golpe, a tensão de uma história séria e o impacto das decisões no decorrer da trama. Sleeping Dogs faz exatamente isso: entrega um jogo com cara de blockbuster, mas com alma de algo muito mais pessoal e intenso. Ele não chega no nível de grandiosidade técnica e inovação de GTA 4 e 5, mas quando se trata de narrativa, estilo e combate, ele sabe como brilhar.

Por que Sleeping Dogs é tão especial?

1. História (Nota: 9/10)
Se tem algo que Sleeping Dogs faz melhor que quase todo GTA é a narrativa. Aqui, o foco está no drama, na tensão e na coragem de mexer com as emoções do jogador. É uma história que não tem medo de se arriscar, e mesmo sem ser exatamente inovadora, é muito mais impactante do que o tom satírico de GTA V. Quem gosta de histórias com peso emocional vai se sentir em casa.


2. Gameplay (Nota: 8/10)
O combate corpo a corpo é, sem dúvida, o ponto alto. Inspirado em artes marciais, ele traz fluidez e brutalidade que poucos jogos de mundo aberto conseguem alcançar. Adicione perseguições de carro cinematográficas e tiroteios competentes, e você tem uma jogabilidade sólida e variada. Porém, falta aquele polimento extra que jogos como GTA IV e GTA V oferecem.


3. Gráficos (Nota: 7.5/10)
Visualmente, Sleeping Dogs faz um bom trabalho. Hong Kong é vibrante, cheia de vida e detalhada o suficiente para te imergir no ambiente. Não é um jogo que vai te impressionar tecnicamente, mas o estilo visual compensa qualquer limitação.


4. Trilha Sonora (Nota: 8.5/10)
A música do jogo é um deleite. Seja nas rádios ou nas composições originais, a trilha sonora te envolve e complementa a ambientação urbana asiática de forma adequada.


5. Variedade (Nota: 7.8/10)
Corridas, missões secundárias e eventos menores adicionam vida ao mundo, mas o jogo é mais curto do que a maioria dos títulos do gênero. Ainda assim, tudo que está ali é divertido e bem feito.


6. Estilo e Combate (Estilo: 9/10 | Combate: 9/10)
Poucos jogos têm tanto estilo quanto Sleeping Dogs. Cada golpe, perseguição e escolha narrativa exalam personalidade. O combate, com cenários interativos e coreografias dignas de filme, é facilmente um dos melhores já vistos em mundos abertos, deixando visível uma coisa que é um fato, o combate de Sleeping Dogs é muito superior ao combate de GTA5, mas eu ainda acho o combate do GTA4 é superior por ter oque o GTA5 deveria ter, agora comparado ao combate dos outros jogos da franquia GTA ele vence sem dificuldades.


7. Originalidade (Nota: 7/10)
Apesar de não reinventar a roda, o foco na cultura asiática e na trama séria dão a Sleeping Dogs uma identidade única. Ele pega ideias familiares e as mistura de uma forma que ainda soa fresca.

Comparações e Conclusão:

Quando colocado ao lado de GTA IV e GTA V, Sleeping Dogs é superado em quase todos os quesitos – exceto pela história, onde deixa GTA V para trás com seu drama mais bem construído. Mas se compararmos com qualquer título da série GTA anterior ao 4, ele vence sem esforço.

Se você busca um jogo com narrativa envolvente, gameplay brutal e uma ambientação rica em detalhes culturais, Sleeping Dogs é exatamente o que você precisa. Não é perfeito, mas entrega algo raro: alma e personalidade.

Nota Final: 7.8/10

184574849.review:
O famoso "GTA da China"!  

Esse game narra a jornada de um policial infiltrado em uma das facções criminosas mais famosas da China, inspirada em uma organização real. Lançado antes do gigante GTA V, o jogo não deixa a desejar, com gráficos e detalhes incríveis. Ele oferece diversas interações com o cenário, comparáveis ao nível de Mafia 2 da 2K. O leque de roupas disponíveis para o personagem é vasto, e a ideia de associar habilidades específicas a cada traje é excelente.  

O foco principal do jogo é o combate corpo a corpo no estilo Kung Fu. No entanto, na minha opinião, as lutas finais acabam ficando repetitivas devido à falta de variedade nas ações dos inimigos. Há também uma jogabilidade com armas de fogo, que é bastante básica. Elas só podem ser usadas em missões específicas, obtidas de inimigos, ou pela cidade, com NPCs.  

O mundo aberto do game é excelente, bem detalhado e enxuto. As missões secundárias são divertidas, pois envolvem interações com diversos personagens que complementam bem a narrativa principal.  

Resumindo... Vale muito a pena jogá-lo! A temática chinesa e a trama de um policial infiltrado, combinadas com um bom combate e uma narrativa envolvente, garantem uma ótima experiência e um tempo de jogo bem aproveitado.

184456047.review:
Настоящая жемчужина, которая незаслуженно прошла мимо многих. Я купил её по скидке, и она подарила мне массу эмоций и незабываемых впечатлений. Это была игра, в которую я с удовольствием погружался на выходных — как перед работой, так и после неё.

Сюжетная линия — просто огонь! Она захватывает с первых минут и держит до самого конца. Единственный нюанс — финал. Мне показалось, что история главного героя не завершена полностью, словно его путь ещё не окончен. Это оставляет лёгкое ощущение незавершённости, но, возможно, это и добавляет игре шарма.

DLC, увы, подкачали. Они выглядят откровенно слабыми на фоне основной игры. Проходил их с большим трудом, чтобы закрыть игру на 100%. Но основная кампания настолько хороша, что эти дополнения не могут испортить общее впечатление.

Sleeping Dogs — это тот опыт, который должен пережить каждый. Если вы любите атмосферные экшены с сильной историей и живым миром, то эта игра для вас. Я очень рад, что прошёл её на 100% — это были часы чистого удовольствия. Рекомендую!

184378709.review: Très bon. Je n'en suis qu'au "début" mais j'ai bien aimé. Le gameplay est varié et bien pêchu. On ne s'ennuie pas. La difficulté est progressive pour nous laisser assimiler les nombreuses mécaniques du jeu. J'aime particulièrement les missions en voiture qui nous font parcourir la ville, écraser les piétons et crasher les autres véhicules tout en écoutant la musique zen sur les radios locales. Si comme moi vous prenez ce jeu au 3eme degré, l'humour est omniprésent. C'est une déferlante de personnages, de situations et de dialogues à la fois caricaturale et comique bien réalisée. Ca n'est pas non plus du comique grotesque et exagéré mais au contraire suffisamment dosé pour être crédible et immersif à la manière d'un bon western. 184303187.review:
This, is [b] art [/b]. The most humbly underrated open-world game of ALL time.

After my forth or fifth playthrough, I was left with only one question. 
"How did they give birth such an alive environment that highlights the line between chaos and loneliness perfectly? the virtual world where you feel a sense of belonging, knowing you are here, right where you are meant to be", developers of this masterpiece claiming "Hong Kong has never felt so alive." was just an understatement.

Wei Shen, a multi-dimension character, reeking of mystery and depth, a paradox of loyalty and responsibility, balanced in lines of ruthlessness and empathy, finding himself at constant crossroads of morality, finding his path in the chaos of Hong Kong, giving meaning to brotherhood and mission.

A story so compelling, yet not complicated.

There is something for someone, for everyone, anywhere in this game.

The music catalog that does not subject itself to mainstream, but to bringing full compatibility to what you are witnessing, so deep within the origins, that it took me 3 years to find just one song available for download, on the internet.

Details so uninvited that you forget this is a synthetic world consisting of zeroes and ones, so deep that after finishing the game you find yourself feeling that you left a piece of yourself in Hong Kong.

This, will never happen again in the gaming industry. ever.

184264337.review:
I've been deceived. There are absolutely no dogs in this game. Not even at the food stalls.

Aside from that, this is a solid GTA-like game with kung-fu fights, gun fights, c0ck fights, pork buns, car chases, detective investigations, dates with girls, mahjong [spoiler]it's just poker with tiles[/spoiler], armored van hijackings, karaoke, and home decoration. It feels exactly like a Hong-Kong action movie. The story is a bit short, but it's intense and full of intrigue and revenge. Unfortunately, there is no endgame, because none of the side activities can be replayed.

The city is also somewhat lackluster. It looks really good, but it's the most restrictive of all GTA-like games. Everything is fenced off, and huge areas of the city are inaccessible. Also, there are very few indoor areas, and not much verticality in a city of skyscrapers.

There are several small things that the developers could have fixed in this Definitive Edition to improve the QoL of game tremendously. For example, having more than 4 save slots (fortunately the two major DLC stories have their own save slots). Or showing type of the vehicle upon entering one. Or the ability to permanently set the color of the vehicles in the garage. Or fixing the random track selection of the radio: the stations always like to play the same 2-3 songs even though each of them have around 20 in their repertoire. Sadly, these will never happen, because the game didn't meet the insane sales expectation of Square Enix, and they disbanded the studio.

184114313.review:
First Gameplay: https://youtu.be/TMPFyHuOM68

Sleeping Dogs is one hell of a game and would have gave GTA a run for it's money if it was still around. The game has a story that takes itself seriously and unwraps it's characters in depth instead of leaning on the extremes that are memes/satire. The game has you play as Wei Shen who just came back from America to find his old mates running the streets of Hong Kong as part of a criminal organization. And you have to prove yourself worthy to move up the ranks while keeping your cover as an undercover cop. So you play as both a cop helping out the law in secret while also breaking the law in order to get to the top and the game shows just how such a stressful experience can take a toll on a person to a point where they cannot tell where to draw the line between the two worlds as both have their own criminal activities involved. The gameplay is smooth for a 2012 game and the graphics still holds today, in a stylistic fashion. Enemies can be defeated with martial arts, which has great combos and takedowns for an open world  that can also be utilized as a weapon against enemies. There is also use of guns and hand-to-hand melee weapons like knives, bats, etc, althought the game mostly focuses on beating enemies up in order to arrest them. This is a beautiful game that not only explores the gang world but a beautiful cullture too, I used to think it was Watch Dogs that was supposed to give Rockstar a run for their money but they were run by Ubisoft, even thoguh I do appreciate that they managed to give us 3 of them all between GTA 5 and GTA 6. I can only imagine where would sleeping Dogs be today if they kept going with this beautiful experience of a game.

Nightmare In North Point Gameplay : https://youtu.be/Ypx3lftyags

Nightmare in North Point brings one hell of an experience as an expansion to Sleeping Dogs. No like literally, a hell of an experience, as you are now dealing with the dead that have a grudge against you. You know the things you did when playing the main campaign,, this is what you have to deal with now. This plays well on Wei Shen's conscience after the events of the game, and the consequences and trauma thereof. This is quite an enjoyable that is a perfect length that it does not overboard with the jokes and horror, keeping the gameplay engaging through this nightmarish journey.

Year of the Snake Gameplay: https://youtu.be/DMAiBMr6TgU

The Year of the Snake DLC really takes this game to the extreme. The main campaign focused on the duality of living as an undercover cop in the depths of a  criminal world, Year of the Snake takes the experience to being an officer of the law and facing the criminal threats head on in the streets. This shows how risky it can be dealing with the unknown and having to protect masses of people during a festival while having to follow the law, detaining criminals. I wish this series continued growing, I wonder what it could have been today, it is such a masterpiece.

184019549.review:
I've played only 40+ hours but i can confidently say i don't even experienced a quarter of this masterpiece.

[h1] GRAPHICS [/h1]

It's mindblowing what they did with 5 times less development budget than GTA V, the graphics are immersive and it shines when you go downtown, the cars have simple design but they look cool, the city is dense with lot's of collectables, the humans look ok but the landscape looks great and alive, you feel the world is vivid and the people really live there, the water physics and interactions are one of the best i've ever seen in any game, the water look and feel just right, not overly simulated or like gelatin. (like in GTA)

[h1] NPC [/h1]

By far the weakest point of the game, the npc's feel clunky and that can break the immersion often, the A.I do work just fine in 80% of situations but sometimes tasks as easy as the NPC opening a car door can be a challenge if there is a trash can near or something.

Their response to enviromental change is pretty fascinating, they can use an Umbrella, drop it if they get hit or you stumble into them, react in a group formation if you hit them in a crowd and every one of them have their own fighting style, it can be a bulky guy with great defense and you can't greaple them, it can be a skiny guy that hits fast with a knife or something in between. npcs can also use common items to cover their heads during rain.

You can see them working common jobs, carrying boxes, eating ramen in social situations and that just goes to show how alive the world of sleeping dogs is!
There is also random events like thief stolling a purse and you can chase him, returning the purse grants you with some money and the girl thanks you.

In combat they work just fine, it's pretty average of what you want in a open world game, there is no lost of immersion there.

[h1] COMBAT [/h1]

The combat is complex but easy to get into, you have weak/strong kicks, Wei (the protagonist) use mainly kicks to attack his opponents, He uses Kung fu with a combination of other martial arts.
You have a Skill tree where you can develop new attacks and even some defensive grabs, like getting your oponent to the ground and disarming him, or grabbing their guns.

A really cool mechanic is to kick multiple people without moving, that is really usefull when you are in a place crowded with enemies (even tho in those situations running is easier) but it's always a nice option in your arsenal. If you like open world games with great combat i cannot recommend this game enough

[h1] MAP [/h1]

As i said on the graphics part of this review the map is very dense and highly detailed, the cities are not big but they are really dense and you don't feel like it's a video game, you have tons of different types of architecture and designs that even this GIANT review is not able to give enough credit to the developers.

Parkour is not an essensial part of the gameplay (like in dying light) but it is satisfatory and the world is build for the parkour, for an exemple if you almost fall over a edge the charecter grabs it self and have a animation of them pulling themselfs up, that seems like not much but that is the difference between falling to your death and barely making it, wich gives a nice tension to the game.

[h1] STORY [/h1]

I haven't completed the main story (yet) but i really enjoy the duality between Wei beeing a cop and seeing himself fall into the crime world and always questioning him and the police's decision, some important charecters die but that just goes to show how real crime is, people die justly and injustly all the times you are gonna be inside the shooting without much option but to fight to your death, i really like the story but these dynamic of beeing an undercover cop drives the mainplot in a interesting way, like times when Wei uses his police contacts/hacking abilities to help the gangs.

[h1] OTHER [/h1]

The main story is 10/10 but there is also two other game modes Nightmare in North Point (NP) And Year of the Snake (YSN).

NP is pretty mid, the powers are cool but there is not much to explore and do, The YSN missions in the other hand are awsome, it's nice beeing able to play as wang just as an average cop, and his interections with the world as one are a nice contrast to wei (as a gang member in the main story)

Car racing is not really my thing, but bike ones are the coolest racing missions and you feel the tension of riding at really high speeds

[h1] CONCLUSION [/h1]

This game is nothing short of a masterpiece, it is not perfect and i could double the size of these review but my main point is Sleeping dogs is not a game you should be sleeping under, for gods sake play this game and tell me if you love open world games if you desliked it, because i'm 99% certain you won't :D

An overall 8.5/10, this is a game that will forever be memorable in my heart. Wei Shen, you're the man! And I could really use a pork bun.

183933805.review: When I was around 12 years old my mom bought this game for my Xbox 360. I beat the game multiple times and enjoyed it from what I remember. I recently bought it when it was on sale to revisit it since it's been a long time since I last played it. It was still good as I remember it being. Sleeping Dogs focuses on melee combat with light parkour and gunplay. The story follows Wei Shen an undercover cop who has infiltrated the Sun On Yee triad and must balance between being a cop and a triad member. I was invested in the story from start to finish. I liked many of the characters specifically Jackie and Ricky they grew on me the most out of all the characters. The open world is filled with a lot of side objectives to do. I won't go into specifics because I don't want to spoil anything for first-time players. This was my first time playing the two DLCs and I enjoyed both of them. I did end up going for all the achievements because I wanted to experience the game to its fullest extent. It was a fun experience. It wasn't difficult to complete just lengthy. Overall, I fully recommend this game to anyone who missed out on playing it when it first came out. On a side note I want more new people to play this game. I feel like its underrated and doesn't get recognized enough. PS: R.I.P United Front Games 2007-2016. Instead of them working on Sleeping Dogs 2 they decided to work on and ended up canceling a game called Triad Wars (A free to play online game set in the exact same map as Sleeping Dogs) which ultimately contributed to them shutting down.

183876053.review: Sleeping Dogs is an absolute gem in the world of action-adventure games. One of the my favorite features is its exceptional combat system. Inspired by classic martial arts movies, the hand-to-hand fighting mechanics are incredibly fluid and responsive. The game allows you to perform a wide array of moves, counters, and environmental takedowns that are both brutal and satisfying. Whether you're slamming enemies into fish tanks or disarming foes with swift moves, the combat never feels repetitive or dull.

183872160.review:
Gameplay:
Level & World Design: 2/2
Controls & Responsiveness: 2/2
Glitches/bugs: 3/3
Side modes (dlc, minigames): 1/3
General Fun Factor: 7/10
Total score for gameplay: 15/20

Notes:
Sleeping Dogs plays great. Hand-to-hand combat in this is amazing. It uses a very Arkham-like style of fighting gameplay, and this serves the game very well. Unlocking new combos and moves is also addicting and fun. However, the shooting and driving need to be improved. The driving does not really control all that well and the shooting, while satisfactory, could be refined further. Moreover, the world of Sleeping Dogs has very few minigames. There is not much to do after completing the main storyline, which is quite disappointing.

Story: 
Dialogue: 2/2
Characters: 2/2
Acting: 1/1
Replayability: 0/2
Atmosphere, mood, & variety: 3/3
Plot quality: 6/10
Total score for story: 14/20
Notes:
The story here is decent. I will say that I find it to be quite overrated. In all honesty, it is a relatively basic cop vs criminal storyline. There aren't many surprises which the game has in store for you. However, the story isn't bad by any means. The characterization of Wei Shen is notably fantastic, and the same can be said for most of the other characters. The dialogue and writing is excellent, but the story itself could be refined further.

Content & Price: 8/10
Notes: I think $19.99 is a reasonable price here. The story of this game will take you roughly 11 hours to complete, and the game provides some other dlc modes which I have yet to play through, although I doubt that they will provide much more entertainment than the main story. Overall, I'd reckon that playtime on this game would be something like 11 hours. I doubt that most players (yourself included) will venture into the dlc content. Moreover, as mentioned prior, the game's main story provides no reason for you to replay it.

Total = 37/50
Overall score ≈ 7/10

Many might say this is just another cheap GTA clone and to some extent it is one,but it still brings a few unique things that make it stand out from its more famous counterpart.One of those things is the combat,it's unlike anything you've seen in GTA,you can use martial arts and kick your way like Bruce Lee through the streets of Hong Kong and that's another interesting aspect: that it takes place in a real-life city as opossed to fictional ones and that's something I found really interesting.And while the combat did feel clunky at first,when you finally learn all the moves and know how to properly use them it does become suprisingly fun,just not quite Arkham Batman level.
   As for the story,I can't honestly say I found it to be all that engaging,though the whole undervover cop plot is interesting it just feels so fast-forward most of the time and it also ends very abruptly,even though I'm sure it was intended to be this way.Also shout out to both Emma Stone and the late Tom Wilkinson for providing some of the voices,really cool that they hired Hollywood actors for this and it shows how much effort was put into it.
  The open-world is a lot smaller than I thought and the side-activities are there for those who wish to complete them,but they're nowhere near as interesting or fun as those from GTA and they can get a bit repetitive,but at least there is some post-game content rather than nothing.
    Overall,a pretty solid and might I say underrated crime game that has become more and more appreciated over the years and while it's not GTA and I don't think there can even be something that can compete with it,it's perhaps the closest best thing and it's definitely worth your money on sale as you get a ton of content for a very cheap price,not to mention the DLC which I still have yet to play. 7/10

183715035.review:
[i]“Вулиці Гонконгу — це джунглі. Тільки тут, якщо ти не покажеш зуби, тебе з’їдять.”[/i]

[b]Рецензія на Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition[/b]

[b]Графіка:[/b]

Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition пропонує оновлену графіку з покращеними текстурами, освітленням і моделями персонажів. Візуальне оновлення робить світ Гонконгу ще більш яскравим і деталізованим. Відкриті локації, а також інтер'єри різних будівель тепер виглядають значно краще, і міський пейзаж справляє ще більше враження завдяки покращеному освітленню та атмосферним ефектам.

Але, хоча покращення очевидні, інтерфейс і анімації персонажів все ще не на рівні сучасних стандартів, що іноді може вибивати з ігрового процесу. Водночас зміни на рівні загального вигляду допомагають краще зануритися у світ гри.

[b]Геймплей:[/b]

Геймплей залишився майже без змін, що є як плюсом, так і мінусом. Бої з використанням кунг-фу й карате залишаються динамічними й видовищними, а вибір між відкритими місіями та дослідженням світу зберігається. Система модифікації зброї та автомобілів також доступна, що дозволяє ще більше кастомізувати свій стиль гри.

Попри те, що ігрова механіка не зазнала значних змін, покращена графіка та плавність анімацій роблять процес гри більш приємним. Оновлене розв'язування завдань у відкритому світі та нові подробиці у механіках крафтингу також додають розмаїття в ігровий досвід.

[b]Сюжет:[/b]

Сюжет залишився незмінним. Гравець все так же бере на себе роль Вея Шена, агента під прикриттям, який проникає в китайську мафію Гонконгу. Історія наповнена кримінальними інтригами, емоційними моментами та долями персонажів. Кінцівки і вибір, які гравець робить під час гри, залишаються такими самими, але завдяки покращеному графічному оформленню вони здаються більш виразними.

[b]Музика:[/b]

Музичне оформлення залишається на високому рівні, з чудово підібраними радіостанціями, які забезпечують справжню атмосферу Гонконгу. Від ретро-хітів до сучасних треків — саундтрек підсилює атмосферу в кожному куточку світу гри. Оновлений звук і поліпшення у звукових ефектах також роблять ігрову атмосферу ще більш живою.

[b]Недоліки:[/b]

Деякі механіки й анімації персонажів виглядають застарілими порівняно з сучасними іграми.

Геймплей залишився майже без змін, що може не сподобатися тим, хто чекав на суттєві нововведення.

Відсутність значних змін у сюжетних аспектах може зробити гру менш цікавою для тих, хто вже проходив оригінал.


[b]Оцінка:[/b]

Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition отримує 8/10. Це вдосконалена версія вже чудової гри, яка робить старий проект більш привабливим завдяки покращеній графіці, звуку й плавності ігрового процесу.

[b]Підсумок:[/b]

Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition — це чудове покращення оригінальної гри, яке зберігає всю ту ж захоплюючу атмосферу кримінального світу Гонконгу. 183634512.review:
An amazing game that I've played many times before on Xbox One. I'll still always be sad that the sequel was cancelled but what is here is amazing. I took the liberty of getting the 100%, and my main complaints about the game are difficulty and DLC quality. The combat is extremely fun, but I didn't die once when playing through the entire game, and slo-mo in gunfights is really easy to take advantage of. My past experience contributes to that, but still, I wish the game had a difficulty select or something. 

Year of the Snake and Nightmare in North Point are the major DLCs of the game, and while they can be fun, they also feel lacking in a lot of areas and don't expand upon the already established story at all. Speaking of which, it's great, gory, and pretty messed up. Either way, amazing game that doesn't get enough credit and an absolute steal for its asking price. 9.5/10 

(P.S: some of the side content such as lockboxes and cameras are tedious as hell so good luck if you go for full completion)

183599926.review:
🎮 Sleeping Dogs Review 🎮
🌟 Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5)

Ever wondered what Grand Theft Auto would look like if it had martial arts, a gripping undercover cop storyline, and the most satisfying pork bun vendor in gaming history? Welcome to Sleeping Dogs, the game that punches harder than a roundhouse kick to the face.

What Makes It Amazing:
✅ Storyline: You play as Wei Shen, an undercover cop balancing loyalty to the law and the Hong Kong triads. It’s like Infernal Affairs but with more broken noses and fewer existential crises.

✅ Combat: The hand-to-hand combat is the star of the show. Forget guns—this game makes every punch, kick, and environmental takedown feel incredibly satisfying. Ever thrown a guy into an aquarium or slammed his face into a meat hook? No? You will.

✅ Atmosphere: Hong Kong comes alive with bustling markets, neon-lit streets, and chaotic traffic. The city feels like a character in its own right, and it’s a joy to explore.

✅ Activities: When you’re not taking down gangsters, you can sing karaoke (badly), gamble on cockfights, or eat pork buns for that extra edge. Truly, the most versatile undercover cop experience out there.

✅ Driving: Surprisingly fun and action-packed, with insane stunts, hijacking moves, and physics that make Fast & Furious look tame.

The Quirks:
⚠️ Driving AI: Sometimes the cars drive like the players are extras from Mario Kart. Expect some hilariously chaotic moments.

⚠️ Limited Gunplay: While the combat shines, the gun mechanics are more straightforward. Don’t expect Call of Duty levels of depth here.

⚠️ Karaoke: It’s great fun, but be prepared for Wei Shen to hit some hilariously flat notes.

Final Thoughts:
Sleeping Dogs is the ultimate mashup of action, storytelling, and immersion. It’s a game where you can bust up a gang, leap off a motorcycle onto a moving car, and then chill with some dim sum—all in the same day.

If you love martial arts, open-world games, and stories with a heart, you owe it to yourself to experience this hidden gem. Plus, the pork bun vendor will remind you: “A man who never eats a pork bun is never a whole man.”

11/10 would spin-kick a gangster into a fish tank again.

183537973.review:
After sinking countless hours into Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition, I can confidently say this game is an underrated gem. The story hooked me right from the start – Wei Shen is such a compelling protagonist, and the whole undercover cop dynamic kept me on edge. The mix of brutal martial arts combat and fast-paced driving makes every mission feel like a scene from an action movie.

The world-building is fantastic. Hong Kong feels alive – whether I was fighting in the streets or just cruising around at night, the city had this gritty charm that pulled me in. I loved the side missions and the DLC, especially Nightmare in North Point – it added a cool supernatural twist to the game.

Sure, the graphics show their age in places, but the improvements in this edition make it look solid for its time. Performance was mostly smooth, with only a few minor hiccups during chaotic scenes.

Overall, Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition isn’t perfect, but it’s a blast to play. If you love open-world games with strong storytelling and badass action, don’t miss this one.
